synopses.small: Adam's put on the spot when he's asked to perform a gay wedding.
synopses.medium: Comedy about the vicar of an inner-city church. Adam's put on the spot as he's asked to perform a gay wedding. Can he give the couple what they want whilst sticking to church law?

synopses.small: In spite of all evidence to the contrary Martha fights to defend her ex-lover's innocence.
synopses.medium: Martha's case continues and tensions are high as the evidence stacks up against Sean. Has he been completely honest with her, and is she really cut out for this world?

synopses.small: Today's most popular programmes available on BBC iPlayer.
Mick delves further into his mysterious encounter, while Denise and Shabnam hatch a plan.
synopses.medium: Mick decides to delve further into his mysterious encounter, but will he get the answer he was hoping for? Denise and Shabnam hatch a plan, but what are Shabnam's true intentions?

synopses.small: Louis Theroux meets patients battling for their lives in LA's most famous hospital.
synopses.medium: Documentary. Louis Theroux explores the American way of death as he looks at end of life care in LA's most famous hospital, the Cedars-Sinai Medical Centre.

synopses.small: Milady seeks her ultimate revenge. Can the Musketeers outwit her or will she destroy them?
synopses.medium: An unexpected rift threatens to blow apart the Musketeers. Will they repair the damage, or will Milady succeed in wreaking her final revenge?

synopses.medium: Emma Willis and Marvin Humes present the live semi-finals, as each artist performs one carefully selected song before taking part in a group number.

synopses.small: Suzi Perry presents coverage of the Malaysian Grand Prix from Sepang.
synopses.medium: Suzi Perry presents coverage of the Malaysian Grand Prix from Sepang, where Sebastian Vettel triumphed in 2013. With commentary by David Coulthard and Ben Edwards.

synopses.small: Mick's family loyalty is put to the test when he receives an unexpected call.
synopses.medium: Mick's family loyalty is put to the test when he receives an unexpected call. Lucy's lies trip her up, but will she be able to salvage her plans for the business?

synopses.medium: Film following students from the Death Penalty Clinic at the University of Houston as they fight last-ditch appeals for two of the youngest killers facing execution.

synopses.small: The spies investigate an assassination plot against the deputy prime minister.
synopses.medium: Children's spy drama. The spies are about to give up on their new freelance careers, when a government worker comes to them for help.

synopses.medium: Celebrity chat with comedian Michael McIntyre. Michael is joined by singer-songwriter Gary Barlow, adventurer Bear Grylls and TV cook and author Nigella Lawson.

synopses.small: In the last century of their rule four Plantagenet kings are deposed and murdered.

synopses.medium: Jacqui Oatley is joined by England Women's manager Mark Sampson and last season's Player's Player of the Year, Natasha Dowie. With a preview of England's next World Cup qualifier.

synopses.small: The team investigate the ill effects of old age, from weakened bones to dementia.
synopses.medium: Science series. The team investigate the ill effects of old age. Maggie Philbin looks at how our muscles change as we get older, and Liz Bonnin explains how bones are made.

synopses.small: Mary Berry reveals clever tips for throwing a casual weekday supper.

synopses.medium: Adaptation of Lionel Shriver's novel. A woman looks back on her son's childhood after he commits an act that damages their community and relationship forever.

synopses.medium: Documentary presented by writer Tim Kendall about the First World War soldier-poet and composer Ivor Gurney, whose powerful poetry captured the experience of the ordinary soldier.
